thread.title: Crocked Tottenham star Harry Kane watches England pals train at Spurs' training ground
thread.title_full: Crocked Tottenham star Harry Kane watches England pals train at Spurs' training ground

author: Liam Corless
title: Crocked Tottenham star Harry Kane watches England pals train at Spurs' training ground
text:
Sport Crocked Tottenham star Harry Kane watches England pals train at Spurs' training ground Kane, who is currently out with an ankle problem, watched his international teammates as they were put through their paces ahead of Saturday's World Cup qualifier against Lithuania Share Harry Kane attended England's training session on Saturday (Photo: The FA Collection)   
Harry Kane paid his England pals a visit on Saturday as he watched them in training ahead of their World Cup qualifier against Lithuania. 
The Three Lions are preparing for Sunday's Wembley clash at Tottenham's training ground and Kane took a bit of time out to go and see Gareth Southgate and co. 
Kane is currently out with an ankle injury and was already at training in the morning to do a bit of rehab work. 
The 23-year-old hasn't played since Tottenham's win over Millwall in the FA Cup two weeks ago but manager Mauricio Pochettino is hopeful he will return shortly after the international break. 
England, meanwhile, will maintain their place at the top of World Cup qualifying Group F by beating Lithuania. Kane is currently out with an ankle injury (Photo: The FA Collection) The striker hasn't played since Spurs' 6-0 win over Millwall on February 13 (Photo: The FA Collection) Mauricio Pochettino hopes to have the striker back shortly after the international break (Photo: The FA Collection) 
They'll have to do it without three of their regular centre-backs, though, with Phil Jones, Gary Cahill and Chris Smalling all out. 
Cahill is suspended while Jones and Smalling both withdrew from the squad last week due to injuries. 
Middlesbrough's Ben Gibson was handed his first senior call-up after Smalling's withdrawal on Friday but it is John Stones and Michael Keane who are expected to make up the Three Lions' defensive partnership at Wembley. Like us on Facebook
